channel.title: Quick help, please? :)
channel.description:
So like, i have hosted servers but i only host them using utorrent as the portforwarding client... i got No-ip client n shit everything works fine, but thing is i dont wana portforward using utorrent because it laggs My Ps3 network wich makes me turn the server off... So yeh
i tried portforwarding with the router thing i Did everything right? heres the video i followed, and yes i do have a netgear router. [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VvzFHHDvU8E]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VvzFHHDvU8E[/url] Please do help me in this...
Im looking forward on buying a vps, if this is not solved i will use utorrent in my vps but heres one silly question.... If i turn my Pc off, my vps will be still turned on right? wich means my server will be on right?

item.title: Quick help, please? :)
item.dc:creator: @lost_it lost it
item.description:
@lost_it wrote:

[quote=“belhelmiel, post:6, topic:402299”]try using http://dewlance.com/vps/winvps.html for your vps its nice and theres 3 places in the us where its hosted dallas in the middle of us and east and west coast hosts. it starts at $12 per month. you just connect to the ip they told you and then you go on there and portforward with utorrent or whatever then you can turn off your computer and your server will stay on.[/quote] Thanks so much man, i would defo go for that Vps but they are out of stock =[

Read full topic

item.title: Quick help, please? :)
item.dc:creator: @lost_it lost it
item.description:
@lost_it wrote:

nsfpure:

Your vps is like an allways on computer, completely seperate from your own so yeah it should still be on even if you shut down your personal computer

Thanks man

Read full topic

item.title: Quick help, please? :)
item.dc:creator: @lost_it lost it
item.description:
@lost_it wrote:

Thanks dean, but im talking about running the server on the vps…

So do i have to do this? Open up my vps… run my server like how i usualy run it in my normal pc, then leave it as it is?

Read full topic

item.title: Quick help, please? :)
item.dc:creator: @Dean1 Dean.
item.description:
@Dean1 wrote:

Yes, if your VPS is hosted online and you don’t have to run anything on your desktop to turn it on then your VPS will always be online.

Read full topic
